title: Introduction to Minikube
content: Minikube is a lightweight Kubernetes implementation that creates a single-node cluster on your local machine. It helps developers test and learn Kubernetes locally without needing a full-fledged cloud setup.

title: Why Use Minikube?
content:
- ‚úÖ Easy to set up and use on local machines

- üîÑ Quickly test apps without cloud costs

title: How Minikube Works
content: Minikube runs a virtual machine or container on your local system and installs Kubernetes components inside it. This forms a local Kubernetes cluster that simulates real-world behavior.

title: Minikube Architecture
content:
Minikube consists of:
- A **driver** (e.g., Docker, VirtualBox, Hyper-V) to run the VM/container
- A **Kubernetes control plane** with API server, scheduler, and controller manager
- A **worker node** that runs containers

title: Install Minikube
content:
```bash
# On macOS (using Homebrew)
brew install minikube

# On Ubuntu
curl -LO https://storage.googleapis.com/minikube/releases/latest/minikube-linux-amd64
sudo install minikube-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/minikube
```

title: Start a Minikube Cluster
content:
```bash
# Start the local Kubernetes cluster
minikube start

# Check status
minikube status
```

title: Accessing the Dashboard
content:
Minikube offers a web-based dashboard for visual management:

```bash
minikube dashboard
```

title: Summary
content: Minikube is a great way to get hands-on experience with Kubernetes on a local machine. It replicates the behavior of a real Kubernetes cluster and is ideal for development, testing, and learning.
